intro: Boliviadendron bolivianum, commonly known as the Bolivian tree, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Bolivia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the high-altitude environment. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
